intro: Aneilema heterophyllum, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and clusters of showy, violet-colored flowers. The plant belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is known for its ability to thrive in moist, well-drained soil. It prefers bright, indirect light and is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value. The leaves are typically glossy and vary in shape, while the flowers bloom in shades of purple, pink, and white.
